definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)

sentences.english: The country has set up special agencies to recommend jobs for graduates.
sentences.chinese: 國家設立了專門機構爲畢業生推薦工作。

sentences.english: Universities and colleges are institutions specialized in training higher level talents.
sentences.chinese: 高校是培養較高層次人才的專門機構。

sentences.english: Now, the two organizations are the United Nations specialized agencies.
sentences.chinese: 如今，這兩個組織都是聯合國的專門機構。

definition: the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD

to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
